title: The app needs SO MUCH work, but it will probably continue to rot
text:
We have used the iBaby Monitor and app every day for almost three years. The camera seems just fine, but the app has always been the pain point. It routinely gets killed by the iOS watchdog for freezing. It is sometimes hard to tell whether our child hasn’t moved in a while or if the app has frozen—until that 15-second window closes and the app gets killed by the OS. This simply is not good enough for quick checks on a child.

The UX itself has received no obvious improvements in the time we have used it. The presentation of the air quality data reported by the camera is a source of serious annoyance and disappointment. The graph is baffling to the point that it is meaningless to me. If anything, this app makes me regret spending extra to get the camera model with the extra sensors. I guess the marketing department at iBaby Labs is skilled at glossing over the shortcomings of the software—you know, the part of the product that is ostensibly flexible and open to continuous improvement.

It saddens me that the software component of this otherwise solid product has been left to languish. Frankly, I was shocked that the company updated the app for the iPhone X (released November 2017). In my memory, that is the only real change that has been made, and that was simply to keep the app from being letterboxed in compatibility mode.

title: Complete WASTE of money
text:
Let me start out by saying I only gave it 1 star because I don’t have the option to leave 0. We received this monitor in September of 2018, set it up but never really used it until March of 2019 when our baby started sleeping in her room, the first 6 months of using it was AMAZING. The reviews I had read were wrong and we truly loved this monitor, then September 2019 rolls around and everything changes. The app starts crashing, when it did work it took forever for the app to send directions to the camera, and if I would try to play music it would crash instantly, and for my daughter that was a huge deal because she had gone the past 6 months listening to the music from her monitor to sleep. It is now December of 2019, I have yet to hear from customer service and I have gone 4 months without a monitor because we can’t afford to get one. The app glitches, even with being reconnected 5 minutes prior (reconnecting it is the same as the initial set up so you have to be right by the monitor to do so, not ideal when you have a sleeping child that you’re trying to not wake up), then even when I finally get the monitor to work it never last longer than a hour. 

Ibaby could be a great thing, but they don’t care about its customers, or fixing the problems with their app. 10 out of 10 DONT recommend.

text: I have had nothing but problems with this monitor. In theory, it would be amazing, but it glitches out on me all the time. I also have issues with the sound. There isn’t much consistency and the sound bar is obnoxious to adjust on my phone. In order to keep white noise or music playing, I leave the sound off and set alerts. Half the time the alerts don’t work either. We both fully tested the alerts before we went to bed, and then woke up to our baby crying. No alerts came through. Luckily we left our bedroom doors open and could hear. This has happened twice in 4 days now. This product is incredibly inconsistent. I am so disappointed in my purchase and would not buy this product or anything from iBaby again. I am currently looking for a new system. I have been battling with this thing for a year. It’s more important now that we’ve transitioned our son into his own bedroom and out of ours. I ignored the negative reviews when I made the decision to purchase and wish I hadn’t. Excuse me while I go reconnect my phone to this thing again...

text:

title: Sorely disappointed
text:
The iBaby M7 had such amazing reviews. We have had it for a year and I honestly believe that the professional reviews we went by were for a completely different product.   The short list of complaints:

* the only device on our mesh wifi network that has constant connectivity issues. We have 5 other full HD cameras; all of them work fine. 

* the iPhone app is the worst battery hog ever.  Even with the screen turned off, only using the app for audio monitoring - I  have never seen any app drain a fully charged phone so quickly. 

* the mini usb power connector is not aligned properly. One cannot simply has connect the power cord. It must be inserted at a very awkward angle or the plug just does not go in. 

* the environmental monitors are not accurate. Especially the thermal metrics which I checked against other controls.   I’m not sure about humidity or c02 but I suspect that they may be inaccurate too. 

* today was the last straw. The M7 suddenly won’t play any music or sound effects. Resetting the app on two different iPhones, nor a full hardware reset did any good.  In fact, now we are without any baby monitor because the factory reset seems to have hosed the device. Despite following all instructions and trying at least 10 times, the setup hangs between steps 1&2. 

I have never posted a review but I am so aggravated with this over priced garbage that I felt the need to warn others.

title: Works OK, but kills battery
text: I have two monitors and this works pretty well. Occasionally it freezes or needs to be force closed. My main issue is that it doesn’t seem to properly put itself into the background. If I use the app and activate listen mode, the app appears to drain battery even if I turn off listening. In the past 24 hours it’s been running in the background for 21 hours, using 25% of my battery usage, even though I haven’t had audio on in the background at all. It’s nice to be able to have the audio in the background but there’s no real reason to have so much background activity. My only guess is that it continues to listen to continues to run to provide notifications about temperature or air quality — but in my opinion that should be handled by the monitors in the cloud with push notifications.

title: App works, but it needs to finally be updated
text:
We’ve been using our iBaby camera for about 2 and a half years now.  It works.  That’s about it.  There are definitely some glitches, but it has kept working.

That said, the biggest issues are in its cheap design.   After over 3 years, this app only supports the basics.  It hasn’t been updated and is being outpaced by other devices and respective apps.  I would recommend people look beyond iBaby for a monitor.  They clearly are not interested in keeping up.

So what needs to be done?   First, the app only supports running in portrait mode.  You can tilt, and the video switches, but the app itself is still in portrait mode.  This isn’t as much an issue on the iPhone as it is the iPad.   The iPad is mainly used in Landscape mode and you can’t use other apps with it.  It does NOT support split screen, PIP video (when minimized) and other features of the iPad.  Coming from an iOS developer, these are easy to implement.  It just appears that the company has no interest in customer retention or growth.  

Again, I recommend looking at other baby monitors that have adapted.  It is unfortunate, as the device seems like it is very good.  I have noticed other issues, but to me the user interface is the show stopper.

title: Great app with some minor annoyances
text:
Overall I love this app. I can watch my baby sleep or play in her crib without going into the room to check on her!

The temperature and humidity settings are nice to see, so I know she’s comfortable. I’m impressed that the air quality monitor can actually pick up when we leave a messy diaper in the trash on the opposite side of the room! It tells us we have fair or bad air quality. Oops. 

Two things are annoying. I’ve seen others complain about the refresh. As in, they say the monitor shows the baby still sleeping when she’s not even there. I have noticed a lag at times, which is likely our WiFi speed and not the app. The solution I’ve found is to close out the app when I’m done so that it has to refresh the next time it opens. This avoids seeing images that are from the previous time. 

Second annoyance is that the sound and motion alerts pop up in the middle of my screen when I’m in the app watching. That seems dumb. It impedes my view and I have to keep tapping away the alerts to see what’s going on. If that were fixed, this would be a five star review!

title: Hiccups but worth it
text:
I had some hiccups originally with setting the system up, and it not being exactly as advertised.  A little bummed out that customer support never got back to me, but I have still been using my system for 6 months and love it.  A few things I wish I knew-

You can’t have more than two users really, and not more than one owner.  This limits it’s advertised functionality of having more users, but hey, whatever I guess.

The biggest downside is that there is a light on the back of the system that goes off when the wifi is off, or for random reasons. This lights up a dark room and kinda wakes my baby up, even though it is a small light.

Still well worth the cost and all, I do love this app now.  

Volume control could use improvement, and the image capture and image in general is funny in that it zooms the entire UI and not just the image, so everything gets grainy. 

After a difficulter-than-needed learning curve with two very technologically adept parents, we now love it!  Good for this price point and I would recommend.

title: Beware: Company abandons products
text:
Buying iBaby is a terrible decision. We spent a lot of money a couple of years ago on the iBaby M3. This company abandoned that product very soon after, leaving those who bought one very ripped off. Sure, you can buy their latest gadget, but they will soon abandon it and you will have been ripped off. You’re actually ripped off the day you buy it...you just don’t know it yet. 

If they don’t support their legacy products.....why are their current products so buggy and UNSAFE? These things lose WiFi all the time giving you a false sense of security. I don’t trust this brand with good reason. REAL baby monitors don’t have the headaches followed product abandonment that this iBaby mess has.

title: Good, urgently needs an update
text:
Works well as a baby monitor with one serious issue, two annoyances and one feature request.

Serious issue: The big problem I encountered was that the initial M6S device setup was not working. I have iOS 12. It would all for the wireless key and then spin forever. I got it to setup with an older phone with iOS 10, where it asked if I wanted to share the wifi key. Subsequently the app worked ok on iOS 12.

Annoyances: 
1) when opening the app Why is the sound turned off by default? This is a baby monitor! The default should be on.
2)it is clear when comparing to a dedicated FHSS monitor that the sound lags behind by almost a second. This gives a weird wailing echo effect when baby is crying. I have a fast Network and so the device or the software are to blame. 

Feature: What I'd really like to see a red indicator at the top left of the iPhone (an oval background to the time/carrier display) when in lock mode; this is a shortcut to open the app and serves as an indicator that the monitor is running in audio mode. This is implemented in the "cloud baby monitor" app and is very useful as a shortcut.

text: My 2.5 month old was crying for 15 minutes because this app froze and closed out on its own. It has closed out way too many times to count, where suddenly I don’t hear anything at all ONLY if I am paying very close attention. Sometimes I can’t hear that the sound on my phone has shut off if it isn’t completely silent in the room I’m in. So not okay. I was so upset walking in to my infant besides himself in panic because I didn’t hear him crying. The entire point of a monitor is so that you have peace of mind leaving your children so that you can hear them and see them to know if something is wrong. I’m throwing this monitor away and buying something else. Don’t waste your money. This product/app causes more stress than peace.

title: Better in theory than practice
text:
This app offers many great capabilities: remote controlled video monitoring, tons of music options, voice communication, and recording. 

However, when it comes to using these functions, the results are less than satisfactory. The app is buggy and slow with frequent crashes and few updates pushed from developers. The music is not organized in any discernible fashion and there is no search function. These are relatively minor issues, but they certainly make the app harder to use and could be easily remedied. 

Overall, a nice first try but the lack of follow on improvements tells me iBaby is satisfied with an average at best result.

title: Terrible reliability
text:
The app crashes daily. The sound alerts only work sometimes and often have to be turned off and then on to work again — but more times than not, they still don’t work. The whole point of a baby monitor is to monitor the baby on the go. It’s impossible with this app. We have to leave our bedroom doors open to hear when the baby cries overnight because the app will not inform us. I have an iPhone and the sound alerts don’t work. My husband has a Samsung and the app crashes nonstop. 

Highly disappointed with how unreliable this is for two new parents trying to monitor their baby. 

I do NOT recommend purchasing this camera to monitor your child — it’s that unreliable.

title: Outdated and unreliable!!
text:
This app needs to be updated SO bad!
 Honestly if I didn’t spend nearly $200 on a monitor that is forcing me to use this app I would have already deleted it.

Multiple times a night I have to close and reopen the app sometimes 3+ times in a row just to get it to work right. The screen will freeze and sound will be slowed down or ‘underwater’ feedback. (I have great WiFi and internet and have no other problems with WIFI products.)

The app will quit or even stop working in the middle of the night so when you think it’s giving you feed back and you’ll hear the baby cry or if something is wrong, you won’t. My twins got sick in the middle of the night (& we needed to go to the hospital) and I didn’t get to them right away because the app failed. Luckily one twin was scream crying which is the only thing that woke me up!

It’s ridiculous that a company that charges so much for a product doesn’t care enough to MAINTAIN their apps. Even cal trans fills in sink holes when they come up.

Update and maintain your app or charge %90 less

title: App crashes
text: This worked great for about 5 months. Now the app keeps crashing in the middle of the night and I can barely hear my baby through closed doors and from down the hall. It really bothers me that I cannot even hear my baby so I am going to buy a cheap $10 old school monitor today to use in addition to this. I hope they can fix the app soon because it just stops working in the middle of the night when I’m asleep. Other than that, the camera is good and we like that it rotates, though we wish it could view a little farther down. It has blind spots because it won’t tilt any further.

title: Disappointing
text:
When it works this app is great and the monitor is great! But it is real unreliable. We are due to have another baby and considered buying another one of these... Until just now as neither my phone nor my husband’s phone will load the monitor while my daughter naps.. for the 5th time this week! I’ve had it with this monitor and app. Thankful my daughter is about old enough we won’t need a monitor for her soon. Also tried getting in touch with customer service and no one answered my call, was on hold for 40 minutes (and yes it was during business hours). 
Fix your app and maybe this monitor will be worthy of the 5 stars it is definitely capable of.

title: Good not great
text: The app is decent. It's better than most monitoring apps. However, it would be nice if you could customize the alert settings a little more such as having the capability to have alerts not go off when you're actually in the app. Or if you could have the monitor be able to play music all night long instead of just a short amount of time. Also if there could be an alert letting you know that the monitor has disconnected so I don't wake up in a panic when I see that it has malfunctioned, and my baby could have been crying for a long period of time.

title: Constant freezing
text:
This app has so much potential but constantly freezes and needs to be reset. This is terrible if you intend to use it for monitoring overnight, since you won’t even know when it freezes.
IBaby was quick to respond to my concern, which was nice. However, the solution that they offered was to have a different account on each device I use to view the cameras. Therefore, if you want to switch between your phone, your partner’s phone, an iPad, you need a separate account for each. That’s a little frustrating for us because we use 4 different devices and only have 2 email addresses.
I hope they fix this.

title: Update crashes phone
text:
Review update: since the update a month ago, this app still periodically freezes my phone; last time I couldn’t even reset my phone. This makes the app and their product useless to me until it is fixed. PLEASE FIX THIS!

I’ve been using iBabyCare products for 3 years and have a camera in both children’s rooms. I use them for the absolute basic needs (hearing and seeing my kids) but with the most recent update, the app freezes and then my phone goes dim and won’t respond; it basically freezes my whole phone and I have to shut the phone down. Please fix.

title: Sound turns off and app unreliable
text: So frustrating lately-almost every morning I wake up to find the sound on the app isn’t working- the sound button is lit up showing it’s on but no sound. I have to close the app and re open for it to work. Very frustrating esp when the baby is sick and coughing throughout the night- I NEED to be able to hear him. Also we have always had issues randomly when we open the app and it cannot seem to connect to the camera to show us anything- many times its hours later before it works.

title: Absolute trash
text: I honestly would’ve given it no stars if that was an option. The first couple of days we had this monitor it worked great. Now the app doesn’t work AT ALL. It keeps saying cancelled or session has timed out or connection failed. We have tried resetting the monitor, turning it off and on, unplugging it, turning my phone off and on, deleting the app and then reinstalling it... nothing works. It won’t even let me log into the app now. So I’m done with it. Absolute garbage and waste of money. Tried calling the customer support and nobody answers and the mailbox is full. Go figure. I definitely don’t recommend this monitor. Save your money people.

title: Excited then letdown.
text: I loved the idea of this baby monitor. And when it works - it works well. The issue is the app crashes when it’s left open for longer periods. I work from home and watch my 7 month old baby when she naps as well as when she goes down for the night. I find myself not trusting the alerts to be accurate because the app crashes when it’s open for long periods (and even sometimes when it’s not) so I tend to want to keep the app open but then can’t. Seems like this is a very common issue that the company should do something about…

title: App keeps crashing randomly
text:
Thought it was just me but after reading the reviews it seems everyone is having issues! 

My app just randomly crashes through the night. I leave the app open at night on my nightstand so I can just roll over and look. Luckily baby’s room is within earshot anyways but the last couple of nights I would roll over and my phone would just be on the home screen. App just shuts down for no reason and no indication. Makes for a very restless night. I emailed customer care but doesn’t sound like that will get me anywhere. Definitely will not be recommending this camera to anyone.

title: Crashing
text: I just received this monitor today after purchasing it and it took me over an hour to get it to fully work then after 10 minutes it crashed and said cancelled or network failure then after resetting the device 3 times it let me log in but was not saving photos or videos then kicked me out and crashed again.. now I can not get back into the app this monitor was purchased for my son who has seizures if I would have known I could not use this I would not have wasted my money on this!!! Please fix this bug ASAP if not fixed by tomorrow I will be returning the monitor and purchasing something else

title: Good App, but it still needs some work
text: Been using the MC2 monitor and the iBabyCare app for a month now. The only problem I have is that the app crashes a little too often for my liking and inside the app, the power off toggle option doesn’t seem to work for my monitor. I’ll toggle is to power off and the camera will still be on so I have to unplug the camera from time time to bc I’m afraid it will over heat with it constantly being on.

title: Nearly every release breaks an older iOS version
text:
Always dread the app updates lately as they either barely work or they fail continuously on our older iPhone 5.

It's one thing if you completely aged the device and iOS version out, we'd be happy using the older version of the app for the time being as it worked great.

Instead you claim the current version supports iOS 10.x and it just doesn't.  

Contacting your support is the moral equivalent of dealing with a phone tree as they won't talk to me unless I provide them the info in triplicate or they just ignore you and you never hear from them again.  Meanwhile their forum and other sites have all mentioned these same issues, without any reply from the developer about the ongoing issues.

Just split the development and put the older version up for older iOS users to use and continue to develop the newer apps for the newer iOS versions.  It's a simple switch to do and you've done it before.

title: Terrible app
text: If you are considering buying one of these monitors, DONT! This app is awful. Constantly freezing or otherwise messing up. The newest development is that it drains your battery in the background even though I have background app refresh disabled for this app. You have to manually close it every time you use it or it will drain 50% battery during the course of a day (iPhone XS Max). I contacted customer service and they could not care less. They just told me to close it after each use. What a pain and contradictory to iOS’s design language. I can not believe this app got through apple’s screening process for apps.

title: Horrible
text: Horrible horrible horrible app. Save yourself some money and frustration and time and buy a different monitor from the start. Currently the app doesn’t let you turn off the monitor (used to work but has had a bug for a month or so) and you can’t turn it off from the physical monitor without just unplugging. So it uses a whole bunch of internet bandwidth. I contacted customer service 10 days ago and they told me to watch for an update to fix the problem. Here we are with no update. Customer service was not helpful and neither are the app developers obviously. I’m shocked that this is such a popular monitor.

title: Great overall!
text: Good picture and controls. Reasonably user friendly. Travels easily from home to hotel room/relatives’ homes. Wish the audio quality was better— there’s a lot of background noise and it’s hard to hear what my son is saying at times. For the purpose of hearing that he’s awake the sound is fine but I often have trouble making out exactly WHAT he’s saying (e.g., telling himself a story, talking to his lovey, etc.) I wish I could hear it more clearly (for the cuteness factor). But overall very satisfied!

title: Great product with small issue
text: For the most part, it’s a great item. I can check on my kids and watch the things they do while I’m at work. The only time it stinks is when it won’t connect, which does happen. It leaves you in limbo at times when you can’t see if your child is asleep. Sometimes you can log out and log back in and it works, sometimes you have to delete the app and reinstall and others you have to unplug the iBabyCare and plug it back in.

title: No Support for iOS 11?
text:
Currently, the app doesn’t even allow me to login on an iOS 11 device. Desperately need an update. We’re without a way to monitor the baby, after spending a lot of money on the device.

Had to borrow an old iPad from a friend in the meantime.

UPDATE: The issue has been resolved, but it’s a bummer it took as long as it did. It’s been an issue since the first developer build of iOS 11 and so to have it fixed weeks after the official release is a concern. When my device is my baby monitor, it’s important that it’s working 100%

title: Audio settings are frustrating
text: The lowest volume setting is still extraordinarily loud for being at the lowest spot on a sliding scale. There is a trick to reset it, but babe is usually falling asleep when I need to do the reset. Also, the sliding scale for the volume is awkwardly small. When I try to move the slider I end up clicking elsewhere and the sliding scale goes away and I have to navigate back to the sound/audio screen. An odd thing to complain about, but after 9 months of use it’s just super annoying!

title: Good camera. Would be better if it planned further down.
text: I received this camera at my baby shower and was so excited to use it. The camera and all of its alerts, lullaby’s and different variations of white noise are some of the amazing features to this camera. The one feature it lacks though is the ability for it to pan down further than it does. Also, the feedback or error screen pops up every time you shake your device and the option to disable does not stick. You have to toggle every time you enter the app.

title: M6 and M6S review
text: The app overall is great. We have the ability to toggle from one camera to the other, move the cameras seamlessly and keep an eye on our babies at all times. What would be nice is to be able to see two cameras at one time with a bigger screen. The app currently only has a dime sized side by side view. If the images could be stacked on top of each other in landscape view that would be ideal given everyone uses their phone as their “monitor”.

title: Great app, lifeline.
text: This app is a lifeline to helping my mother who has beginnings of vascular dementia. Small issue, when you contact customer support, they send you an email that is confusing, it makes you think you have to jump through hoops for your email to be officially sent to them. In reality, the original email actually goes through. A little bit confusing.

title: Unreliable & waste of money.
text:
I really wish I had not purchased this monitor. The connection is always spotty and there seems to be no rhyme or reason to when it’s good and when it’s bad. Usually every other night the app simply cannot connect to the monitor and we just get the spinning wheel. We have to unplug the monitor and plug it back in to get it to work again. Not exactly something that’s easy to do in the middle of the night. Luckily we purchased some vtech audio only monitors to use while traveling to grandparent’s houses so we don’t have to rely on the ibaby. 

We have excellent WiFi (AT&T Fiber, 300 Mbps) and never have issues with any other device.

title: Update broke music/noise function
text: The latest update completely broke the use of music and sound from the device. I’m running an iPhone 7+ with the latest version of iOS. My wife also now can’t use sound on it either. She’s using a standard iPhone 7 with the latest iOS update. Please fix it! We’re now back using another companies sound machine while our son sleeps. Paying well over $250 for this device just for the music/sound feature to break is disheartening. Please fix it ASAP!

title: Works well for one monitor, issues with 2
text: For the last 2 years, we have been super happy with the app and the monitor. However, we added a second monitor in July when our second daughter was born and the app really struggles. It drops the audio feed frequently. It crashes often. We can only control the volume of the white noise half of the time. Disappointing.

title: What is going on?!
text: We have had iBaby used on our 3 kids with no issues until the last couple of months. The other day, it showed I was talking but confirmed when I went in my sons room there was no sound. The listen feature is constantly glitching with multiple audio streams overlapping. After a dozen times, it starts working but by then whatever my son was telling me has long been said. I’ve since ordered an indoor Ring camera to try because we can’t keep waiting for this to self resolve. My wife and I have literally stressed over our inability to safely check on our kids and ensure they’re ok. Moving on!

title: Glitchy App
text:
While the camera itself is fine, the app is awful! 90% of the time, the video freezes and then the app crashes when I open it to check on my little one. It’s pretty frustrating when I want to quickly check in but ends up taking over 60 seconds for the crash/re-start process. 

Also, the app won’t connect to WiFi in hotels. We had to spend $100 on a hotspot + pay a $60 monthly fee when we need to travel. 

Developers- you must find a fix for this issue as it appears to be happening to multiple people!

title: Frequently crashes
text: I love being able to have a video monitor where I can have notifications, sound, and picture; however, the app not only always crashes, but the camera also makes a very audible clicking sound when it switches in and out of night vision, which ends up waking up my baby (I ended up just turning the auto function off and leaving it in night vision). I love the concept, but with the app consistently crashing, I cannot rely on this monitor. —especially overnight. We have a second monitor in the room with our baby.

title: App needs work
text: I bought the camera after a friend recommended it. The camera delivers good video quality in the dark. But the temperature Sensor seems to be influenced by the camera itself as it rises constantly and much higher than the real temperature… but the biggest problem is that when the video gets stuck (and That happens regulary), the loading indicator circle has the same colour as the video stream at night. It is almost impossible to see and there is no audio warning either…

title: Great camera, horrible app support
text: I have had two of these cameras for several years and had little issue with the hardware and am happy with the cameras. The app support has been terrible and buggy. The latest issue is my app crashes within seconds of opening, rendering the cameras virtually worthless. I contacted support and they replied they know of the issue and are working on it. It’s been over two months now and I have yet to see an update. Disappointing and makes me recommend non-app based cameras to others.

title: cannot connect server error msg
text: The app experience is bad, I bought  M7 and the installation took me 30 mins as the app got stuck several times during the process. Then after one day when I checked the monitor through the app, I got the error msg keeps popping out but the monitor is actually connected, this is a real bug and there seems no solution for this. I tried delete the app and reinstall, also tried reboot my iPhone but still cannot get rid of this annoying message, please fix them!

title: Mostly Functional
text:
I ate with the other reviewers that the app freezes up often and sometimes doesn’t alert me until the baby is screaming. I have to stare at the screen few a few seconds to see his chest rise to make sure it hasn’t frozen. The temperature sensor is also high by about 2 degrees. 

I would like to see an icon on the screen letting me know that I have the sound or motion alerts on so I don’t have to flip into the menu to double check.

title: App closes after a few minutes
text: I used to love this app and monitor for nighttime use, however, recently it keeps closing after  just a few minutes of not being interacted with or when I turn my phone to enlarge the screen.  I use this baby monitor to hear and see my child throughout the night and it closes so I can’t and i don’t hear him until he’s screaming.  It’s a really poor planned feature..    I  hope its just a “bug”, but if they don’t fix it, I have to go with a monitor I can rely on.     It’s a shame- I would have normally given a 4 or 5 star.

title: Gotten Worse..
text: This has been a reliable app for the past 2 1/2 yes with our son. Recently it has been closing and crashing every time my alarm goes off or some other app is played with sound. Super frustrating to try and keep an eye out on our toddler. This is happening with tons of reviews- what is the manufacturer doing to fix it? Wanted to get another one for my second coming soon but will look for a different brand until this is fixed. Completely unreliable now

title: It’s fine
text: Was quite difficult to get connected.. not sure if it was the camera or my internet... worked great once hooked up. The temperature and humidity stopped working and they were unable to fix the issue and didn’t offer for replacement. Was told I could buy a new model. Besides that it’s nice and awesome for parents who work late shifts, which is why we got it. Still use it 2 1/2 years later!!

title: Crashing
text:
Nice resolution, you can turn the video cam in any direction, I can talk to my baby through the speaker and I can play music and lullabies. 

However, system crash mostly specially if your wifi connection is not really strong which is not cool at all! Also wish there is a little screen so my baby could see me vise versa...could have been awesome! 

Please try to fix the problem from crashing coz it’s really annoying and it cheapens the product even though its not!

title: Decent and helps monitor baby
text: Generally I have been happy with the iBaby. The app sometimes spins even when my WiFi is working fine and I’m within good range of the monitor. I had to turn off the motion alert altogether. I find the alert goes off too often and I’d would like to have another option for the alert sound. But it has works well enough since we moved our daughter to her own room. Wakes me up at night when she cries. I haven’t tried the voice or music yet.

title: Camera Does Not Work
text: This product was excellent for the first 60-90 days.  After that, the app cuts in and out and the sound hasn’t worked for well over a month.  For the price of the camera, I expected it to work much better and for a much longer time.  I have since contacted customer service to return the camera for full or partial credit.  Said I would hear back within 24hrs...it’s been 72 and still nothing.  I’ll update this review if I hear anything and if they do the right thing on the customer service side.

title: Waste of money
text: Just purchased this monitor 2 day ago, it’s always going off line and won’t connect. I had the Arlo before and the video would lag a ton so got iBaby. This is so frustrating and a piece of crap, I’ve even upgraded my internet so I know it’s an issue with the app or monitor itself. O also not to mention that the speaker is also crap, playing music through the monitor even on a very low volume it is extremely poor quality and sounds like a speaker is blown out or something. Why is it so hard to find a reliable monitor?!

title: Glitchy and the music rarely works
text: Glitchy and the music rarely works. When it does, the volume and quality of the songs vary so drastically that if I don’t pay attention it wakes the baby. Constantly says that it is unable to establish a connection or “buffers” eternally. At least the camera has continued to work and I can still use the listen feature so I can hear if the baby wakes up in the other room. Wish all the features worked consistently, otherwise the price was high for what you actually get.

title: Overall good but the M8 has 2 things I want changed
text:
First off, love the moonlight feature but hate that it auto plays music. Could you change that? 
Secondly, it pans too far in a swipe. I prefer making minor adjustments like the previous cameras. I have the M8 and also the M7 and I prefer the tech of the M7 for those two reasons. Otherwise, it’s a great camera. Thank you.

title: Awesome Device
text: I love the fact that I can be at work and view my baby with Dad through the app at home. I can choose to listen, talk to my baby and/or record. It was an expensive buy for me but I will say well worth it because the camera is clear along with other mentioned positives. This would be a great investment as your child tradition through childhood!

title: Need Apple Watch support!
text:
I want you to thank you for this product and the app, which has helped me so much since we had our son. Please make this app apple watch compatible! We downloaded another baby monitor app (cloud baby) for when we are on the go and it already supports Apple watch, and we didn't have to purchase a $100+ device to go with it. thank you! 
First time mom

title: Fix bugs!
text: So this app has worked perfectly for us for a year and a half and today I went to check on my daughter thru the app while she naps and it kept popping up a message saying “cancelled”. The message popped up like 5 times in a matter of 30 seconds. So i uninstalled the app and reinstalled it and now I can’t even log in. It lets me enter my login info and then the “cancelled” message pops up again and then a “network timeout” message appears and it won’t log me in...

title: Recent update seems to have caused more problems
text:
Worked great for a while. I have 2 monitors and one of them has to be reconnected to the WiFi at least twice a month. After the most recent update there is a huge delay. My daughter walked into our bedroom the other morning and 5 minutes later I heard her coughing on the monitor. App also shuts down constantly. I’m so frustrated!

Update: worked better for a little while. Now it continues to crash. I wake up multiple times worried it has shut off, and it usually has.

title: Sort of fine for a necessary WiFi option
text: The quality of the video on this monitor, especially at night, was surprisingly terrible. I tried working with customer service to see if there was a way to improve it, but no go. The record option — theoretically activated by a noise or motion— was wonky at best. And now the latest—a data breach. We went with this monitor because our home had some barriers to a traditional monitor and so we needed something WiFi based. I bet there are better options out there by now.

title: Wouldn't know what to do without it
text: Our son was born premature and when he started sleeping in his own crib we were so worried but with this camera we would leave it on all night with the sound on and had no worries. Perfect for dad to check up during work or while we have a sitter. Also works great for security cam with alerts with sound or movement.

title: Need to fix crash issue
text: I’m not unhappy with this app. But a major issue for me is that the app crashes A LOT. Most often when the app is still open, I lock my phone, then unlock my phone to check in our baby. Occasionally, but not often, it crashes when we’re actively using it to alert us of crying etc. The silence we hear is because the app has crashed, not because he is quiet. If these could be remedied, I’d be happy to bump my rating up.

title: Love the monitor, app isn’t great
text:
The app isn't terrible, but it’s also not great. It has a tendency to freeze and the ability to play music from your library does not work. Maybe there was a time that feature did work, but it has never worked for me in the 3+ months I’ve owned it. Also, why isn’t there an ability to have two “owners”? The idea that I can be an owner and my wife is just a “viewer” is just silly. 

Again, love the camera itself though.

title: TRASH
text: The app continues to close out randomly and won’t consistently work. We even bought a new ibaby monitor for a 2nd baby and new monitor does it too (which let me know it’s not a camera issue but an app issue). Customer service is TERRIBLE. They give no direction or solution. Constantly ask the same questions and give you the run around. After 3 weeks of having this issue I finally got a response that said it was an iOS issue being worked on. Still no update or fix with app. It’s been a month now.

title: Awful. Don’t waste your money
text: Even as someone who tends to love Apple products, let me say: just don’t! Cuts out on a regular basis (Not a WiFi issues!!!!). It likes to wait until I’m good and asleep and go out completely. Leaving me to sleep a couple hours before I can no longer hear my child. Which is dangerous. Customer service is garbage. And that’s just the big things with the app. Not including the crap design of the device itself, the super delayed interface, the delay sound vs visual, and more. I hope the issues they’ve caused me before we switched will haunt them one day.

title: New update, not good
text: Loved this product and app until the most recent update wiped out all of my pictures and videos. I didn’t save them to my phone because I figured they were safe on my app. Now every picture and video (and there were some good ones!) I have taken from 4 months to 21 months are gone. Not happy.

title: Great offering but crashes a lot
text: Love all the features of this product and app. Only downfall is the app crashes randomly and when changing the volume, it takes you to another screen and you have to tap to go back and often doesn’t adjust until clicking a handful of times. Gets tiring when the baby isn’t sleeping and you’re trying to make quick and easy moves. Otherwise great product.

title: Great Product, splash screen has got to go!
text:
Our iBaby has been working great. The app has been rough at times, but it gets the job done. 

However, the latest update added a bright white iBaby splash screen. Uggghhh! Terrible terrible! I understand that they want to get their branding out there, but the splash screen is bad and had to be an addition forced by management without real world testing. 

The addition of the splash screen delays the time until the video syncs up but worst of all it is SUPER BRIGHT WHITE. When you are checking on your kid in the middle of the night you are going to be blinded with the brightest splash screen known to man. 

Get rid of the splash screen. It delays the video and is terrible in low light situations.

title: M6s
text: Our monitor has great picture quality! Sometimes the alerts are a little to sensitive and need to be adjusted. The night vision is the clearest I have seen. We also love that we can view from anywhere! The hardest part about use is if you change your internet settings and have to reinstall. However customer service has helped me with any issues I had.

title: Has some connectivity issues some times but it works
text: Does the job. Have a few issues here and there but I don’t hate it. There was an update a few days back which resulted in black screens for the video but the monitor was still connected. It was like this for 2 days but looks like they fixed it.

title: Fix The App!!
text:
Camera is great. App is unreliable, I would of expected more from a company that produces baby monitoring equipment. 
The white noise feature plays when it wants to, never stays on for very long, and adjust the volume to a very loud position. While in listen mode the app would just shut off without any notice.

It has been nothing but a head ache from the moment we installed it in our nursery. I have since purchased a very inexpensive separate sound monitor to listen in at night because I can’t rely on this camera and app to work as it was advertised.

title: Just the baby
text: When I turn the app on, all I want to see is my baby- not a screen asking me if I need to get in touch with the iBaby team. If I want to get in touch with you guys, I’d rather go through the trouble of the added step of tapping a button from the video feed of the baby, not the other way around. It just is more helpful that way. I’ll play around with the app more to see if this is a settings issue that I can solve.

title: DRAINS BATTERY
text: I own an M6 iBaby Care Monitor. I loved everything about the monitor and the iBaby Care app until I realized that the app was DRAINING MY PHONE BATTERY. Even when I completely close out the app and turn off background refresh, and only use the app a couple times a day to check in on my son sleeping, it drains 30-50% of my battery each day. That is more battery usage than any other app I use, even when I use another app for hours on screen. There must be something wrong with the app development to cause this issue. PLEASE FIX

title: Disappointing
text: Really disappointed with the performance of this app and camera. We have been using it for two months and has yet to have a day of consistent performance with connectivity, sound, alerts, etc. for such a high rated, high price item I was expecting much more. We ended up having to use a separate sound only hand me down monitor because the alerts fail to work properly regardless of the settings.

title: Disappointing
text: This is not the type of app that can regularly have issues and still keep customers happy. This is what parents are relying on to monitor our babies and that’s something that shouldn’t be taken lightly. All night I have been getting a “network fail” error and I have been unable to get anything done because I can’t monitor my child and that just freaks me out. This needs to be addressed immediately for other parents. I will be purchasing a new monitor tomorrow and will not recommend to any other parents for this reason.

title: Give the people what they deserve.
text:
CAN YOU PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF ALL THINGS HOLY ADD PICTURE IN PICTURE SUPPORT TO THIS APP. 

This is technology from like 2008. It’s available on the current iOS. Make it happen, PLEASE. 

Otherwise it really is a great monitor. Rarely have issues, and outside of it needing the be reset once every few months, I’m super happy with this. But Picture in Picture. Come on. It’s what the people deserve.

title: Potential, but misses by far
text: So much potential, but this app fails its companion product in so many ways despite frequent updates and with the use of a WiFi extender. I spend more time quitting, restarting the app, using the choppy camera controls when I should be monitoring my child. Very disappointed and after update after update, there has been little to no improvement. I can't recommend this app, and therefore the iBaby product to new parents because of these issues. I wish I had gone with a different monitoring system myself.

title: Doesn’t work consistently
text: We like the app just fine, when it works! We are constantly having to restart the monitor as we get the spinning wheel of death every few days. Not exactly convenient because you always realize it needs to be restarted when you’re trying to check on your sleeping baby. So then I basically can’t use the monitor for an entire night since if I restart it, I risk waking the baby.

title: Been like this a long time
text: Edited: They finally fixed it. It worked flawlessly for one week. I mean it was awesome. Then this morning I wake up once again to my baby screaming at the top of his lungs, but not on the monitor, because there is no sound coming out again. What a terrible experience this has been.

title: Local Access slowness
text: There should be an option for local access. Right now if the internet goes down I can’t view a camera in the room next to me. Poor design. Also, any internet slowness is impacting the camera - even if I stand right next to it. This isn’t an issue of bandwidth (I have 200 Mbps) - this is an issue of latency to the vendor’s server. Get a network engineer to help you plan your app better. Right now this camera is nothing more than a way for family to peek in on the kid.

title: Not reliable
text:
Really starting to hate this app!i am shocked that this app has as many stars as it does because I have had it for almost a year now and it never works. The app just doesn’t load probably 35/40% of the time which then makes this expensive baby monitor completely useless half the time. On a different note the picture is no where near as clear as the image shown here, I get advertising and all but come on you can’t even use a real image from your app?! 
Advice: don’t get it, there are much better apps out there!

title: Very good with 2 concerns
text:
Very happy with the app, however I have 1 issue and 1 request. The issue I have is the volume bar disappears often after adjusting it. I then need to force close the app and reopen to get the volume bar back.
The request I have is for a dark mode. Late at night the all-white splash screen is intense and in general the app has bright backgrounds.

title: 9-1-17 update needs to be fixed!
text:
It worked just fine until this last update. Now having the same problem as everyone else, the app is shutting off after a couple minutes. This needs to be promptly fixed. Period.
Update:  the problem was fixed with the next update. Thank you!

title: Unreliable - overpriced - fairly useless
text: For a system that has one simple function, it does it very poorly. The video feed constantly hangs and freezes, very jittery, it's idea of 1080p is simply to apply a noise filter so the image is not crisp at all, color is washed out, it tells you in the marketing that you can play music from iTunes except anything you bought from iTunes is copy protected so that won't work either, the talk back audio rarely works... I could go on and on. So sorry I bought two of these for our home.

title: Glitches & bugs
text: The app , regardless of WiFi connection, continues to crash and now has developed a bug that consistently reads, “cancelled”. Even after having reset the device, re-downloaded the app, the bug persists. This is ridiculous. As a parent, the device is a necessity to properly monitoring an infant and toddler. Having it crash on more than one occasion has become more of a hassle than a value to me. Unless this issue is resolved immediately, as in RIGHT NOW, I’m done with ibaby.

title: Compatibility issue
text: This app has been a good send for my wife and I, but since the IOS 11 release it is no longer working on my phone. Her phone is still in IOS 10.3.3 and my has been updated. With being on IOS 11 I have not been able to get past the login screen. It won’t even allow blame to click on the button. It just sits at that page and I can’t move further. Please fix.

title: Not the best quality
text: Sound of music is bad. Constantly shuts off the app if you want to have it on all night to keep and eye on the baby. Wish they had a home monitor as well that comes with the unit so you don’t have to have it on your phone or iPad when home. Love that it is WiFi so if I’m away from home I can watch my child but needs better quality of sound and a stay at home hand held monitor as well.

title: Why can’t the crashing be fixed?
text: We’ve been using this app for 2 years and just got a second camera for another child. The cameras are great, the app has been TERRIBLE. For months we wake up to the app crashed on all devices. Why has this not been fixed? We’ve recommended these products to friends for the convenience but now we’re going to have to ditch our cameras and go another route. Very disappointing with almost $300 into the products.

title: App is terrible!!
text: The app for this monitor is absolutely AWFUL! It crashes multiple times during the night when you need the monitor most. Completely unreliable. And the customer service is very little help replying back a couple days later each time when they say they will respond in 24 hours. I have a had a ticket open for weeks for the crash issue and they say they have fixed it but are still working on it. They take no pride or accountability for a functional app.

title: Completely nonfunctional in iOS11
text: After updating to iOS 11 the iBaby Care App is completely nonfunctional. I signed out of the app and had to sign in again but I am stuck on the log in screen. I have tried everything from closing and restarting the app to a full uninstall/reinstall to no avail. Please fix your app! Extremely frustrating!

title: App doesn’t work 90% of the time
text:
The app doesn’t work 90% of the time. It either freezes or it just sits there and loops? 
Whenever I put my baby down I want to turn it on immediately, but of course this app doesn’t turn or.... or takes a few restarts to actually allow me to turn the white noise on!
It’s too bad because without the app this machine doesn’t even work. There are no buttons on it that allows me to turn the noise on. It’s way past the return time frame so I don’t know what I’m going to do.

title: Good hardware, horrible app
text:
Just looked at why my phone battery was being drained so quickly. The iBabyCare app constantly runs in the background and used up 68% of my battery even though it was only “on screen” for 4 minutes. You can check this by going to Settings > Battery then scroll down to see what apps use the most battery. 

The app in general is just outdated. Other reviewers have listed everything. It’s in serious need of an update.

title: App closes on its own
text: This app is terrible. The point of having this is to keep an eye on your children while they sleep. It would be ideal to leave the app open while I’m asleep in the next room with the WiFi turned on so I can hear my children and quickly look to see if they are ok but the app constantly closes itself off even when I leave it open with the sound on. I have to keep opening the app back up. Don’t get an IBaby monitor unless they fix this because it defeats the purpose.

title: Love it!
text: This app and the monitor are fantastic.  There are so many songs and stories to play we’ll probably never get to all of them. The only slight downside is that it’s a little slow to pan the camera, and a little tough to make fine adjustments.  But other than that, it’s perfect!

title: Lost memories
text: We used this app from the time my son was a few days old. Captured wonderful moments of his first time rolling over, some moments pushing up, starting to crawl. Sweet times asleep and looking so peaceful. Then one of the recent updates, I don’t which one, cleared them all. We thought they were safe in the app. We thought because they synced across devices that there were copies. Now we’ve lost those moments forever. Be sure to backup your photos that you have captured somewhere else or they might not be there tomorrow.

title: Horrible horrible horrible
text: This app is trash it always crashes and always disconnects from the monitor it’s such a hassle and annoying to have to reconnect it several times before it connects again. Most of the time it doesn’t even reconnect. The alerts are always delayed and the sound hardly ever works. I’ve already complained to the manufacturer called customer care sent in tickets and apparently nobody seems to want to fix these issues. Honestly I should’ve just gotten another brand!

title: Overall I like it!
text: Sometimes it buffers but that could be our internet. Occasionally, it makes loud static noises if I try to play music through it, but mainly I just use it to see my little man.  I keep it on all night by my bed.  I also gave the grandparents the link so they can see their grandson when he’s in bed.

title: APP ISSUES
text:
I really do love this app, it’s great for my child’s room. Ever since I updated the new version, it’s been having pop ups saying ‘cancelled’ or ‘network connection failed.’
I have tried uninstalling the app, logging out, resetting the camera, and even resetting my WiFi router. Now it won’t even let me log back into my account!!
Please fix this!!

title: Sound
text: It has a sound issue, when I leave it on during the night I keep the app up and my phone unlocked and I’ll wake up randomly throughout the night and it shows the “sound is on” but you hear nothing. I have to restart the app to get it going again. So if that happens and my daughter cries I wouldn’t have been able to hear her. Get it fixed ASAP please

title: Fix landscape mode when screen mirroring for 5 stars
text:
Our family loves the device and app works great except for that when you screen mirror on Apple TV and rotate to landscape. It does not fill the screen. Instead it rotates the video on its side. 

Seeing your children rotated 90 degrees doesn’t help :)

Please fix this. Even better drop an Apple TV app. Or both.

title: New update didn’t do ANYTHING
text:
The app still crashes (even throughout the night when I need it the most). You have to force close the app multiple times before you can successfully “power off” the monitor. I still don’t get alerts when my son makes noise, only when he full on SCREAMS (and I definitely don’t need a monitor to know when he’s screaming. And yes, I have the sound on highest sensitivity.)

Nothing changed about this app except it’s appearance. Bravo. 🙄

title: Great updates!
text:
Thanks for adding the split screen function and increasing the size of the picture as well as adding sound from each camera, which can be played simultaneously. 

This app keeps getting better and better!

title: The App is horrible
text:
Pros:
Great video quality, in daylight and night with the built in IR camera. Camera is easily controlled by the app and very responsive. Love that both hubby and I could watch the live feed at any given time from devices. I even set up an old iPad in the kitchen so I could watch the baby’s room while cooking. 

Cons:
The App crashes A LOT!! Given that this is the only way to watch the video. It’s a big big problem. Camera also frequently sends out false alarms, no matter how much I reduce the sensitivity. We’re talking every 10min at times. It was so bad that I just turned off the alarms altogether. I probably restart the app at least 5 times a day, despite that I’m always sure to run the latest app and firmware on the device. 

If this hadn’t been a gift I would have returned it a long time AGI.

title: Upgraded to the M7 Lite
text: This one is even better than our old m6 from our first child. The camera looks better and has a much wider angle to see the entire room and not just the crib. We love our new camera.

title: It doesn’t work half the time!
text:
I hate that it takes forever for any image to come up but most of the time it errors out and doesn’t work. Plus if you put on the motion sensor it so sensitive even when the setting is set to only reasons to high motion activity. 

I contact iBabyCare and they were no help. 

I wish it just worked 😥 The camera either clicks all the time to try and adjust to the light or it’s error light is on red so it mostly unplugged because their stuff doesn’t work.

title: Works great despite negative reviews
text: If the app and video feed is not working...it has nothing to do with the app or product. Your network is the problem.  Get a wireless extender or mesh network so the signals are strong at the camera and your screen.  That solved all our problems

title: Honestly, this whole thing was a waste of money.
text: We splurged and got the more expensive monitor.  Two weeks into use it just stopped.  First the normal non night time mode disappeared and it is permanently stuck in night vision.  Then we got the red light of death and had nothing at all for over a month. Randomly the light turned green again and it had a picture for all of an hour, now nothing is working again.  I can't get anyone from customer service to answer or respond. I am so angry.

title: Great for the whole family
text: We not only use it for the kids but to watch the dogs while we are out. Being able to speak through the camera has saved many crayons and cushions from being eaten!

title: Drains battery
text: This has been an issue for several months now. We’ve used this app for years now but have had to delete it because it has literally taken half my battery life in the past 12 hours (previously I could go 2 full days between charges). Not happy with this app at all.

title: App needs constant upgrades
text: App used to be a lot better. But in need of constant upgrades as the picture gets grainy, lags, and even kicks you off randomly. So sad as I seriously believed this to be the best baby cam out there. Mine as well save the money and expand the Ring network with an indoor stick camera in the baby’s room.

title: Love it
text: I love that I’m able to see my daughter and to know the room is too cold or too hot in that my family can see her and for me it’s also special because for my boyfriend his family is overseas to get them to login and see her it’s a very special feeling for us.

title: Love this!
text: We have had minimal issues with the camera and the app. We use it to check on our disabled daughter at night. I work nights and can check it on my phone at work. I only wish they had an app for the Apple Watch.

title: iOS 14 update
text: I’ve done everything possible to get this app to work on my iPhone that has iOS 14 and nothing works. I’ve reset my phone twice, turned on & off the camera, reset it, all about twice and nothing. Any suggestions? I want to be able to see my baby when she’s sleeping.

title: Keeps crashing since last update
text:
App is Still crashing in 1-2 seconds of opening it after the latest update. 

This app keeps crashing since last update. This expensive camera is useless since last week or so, tried everything as others have said in the recent reviews, nothing works. You have no idea how much I rely on this app/baby camera and now it’s useless. Fix it please, Now!

title: It worked great before the update.
text: I’ve used this on my iPad for over a year without too many problems. However, ever since the update this morning the app shuts itself down almost immediately. If the app doesn’t work the camera is pretty useless. I rely on this to be able to monitor my baby through the night. I really need it to work.

title: Alerts never work
text: The monitor is great and I love having access from any of our devices. However, if you plan to utilize the alert functions they are so hit or miss. They used to work great but in the past few months they have barely worked even when set to high sensitivity which is what I always have it set to. I like to use the alerts so I know what time my kid wakes up.

title: Recently worsened
text: idk what happened but the app does not refresh after its been opened for a while in the background. the app has to either crash or i have to close it out completely and reopen it to refresh the live camera view. Otherwise, the picture quality and zoom are great because I love being able to check my baby’s breathing without going into the room.

title: Constantly freezing up
text: We’ve had this camera for almost 2 years and experienced occasional freezing of the screen but the past couple weeks, it freezes several times a night. And just recently, we started getting a black screen with a spinning wheel when we first open the app.  We can sometimes eventually get around these two issues by closing and opening the app multiple times, which gets tiring at 2:00am.

title: Pictures and Videos Deleted
text: The app stopped working for me so I deleted the app and downloaded it again to see if that would help (it didn’t!). I then realized all of my pictures and videos that I have taken over the course of my daughter’s life were deleted by doing that. The videos of us singing her to sleep, playing by herself in her room, pictures of her sleeping, all gone! And there’s nothing that can be done. I am heartbroken.

title: Battery Hog
text: The iBabyCare app is consistently the biggest user of my iPhone battery even when it is only in the background.  It should not use so much battery as a background activity when I’m not watching the video.  It has been this way for several years and the developers have never fixed this battery drain issue.  At least reduce iPhone power useage while the app is in the background.

title: IBabyCare app m2c installation problem
text: I followed the directions and connected to the m2c unit via WiFi, opened the iBabyCare app on my iPhone and the installation page comes up and says select your product. Unfortunately, only the 2 device choices are visible, and the very top of the 3rd. None of which include the m2c. There’s no way to scroll down to the m2c to select it to finish installation. Tried contacting support via email about a week ago but still haven’t heard back from them.

title: Glitches
text: The features are great, as far as, playing music and being able to record yourself reading a book, or choosing from your own music library.. HOWEVER** there are some bugs that never seem to get fixed.. the night light will turn off randomly, and the app will stop "listening" when it feels like it.. I'm glad it was a gift and we didn't pay for it

title: Stop asking about Push Notifications
text:
Like the app. Like the product. Picture works pretty well and like how it is connected to a server that lets me view when I'm off my home network. 

I do not like how I have to say no to push notifications every time I load the app. Once is enough. If I change my mind I'll go into settings. Let it go ibaby.

title: The white screen blinds me at night
text: Overall great app but when you open it in the middle of the night the screen is BRIGHT white and it blinds you. Not the best color for the middle of the night. I guess it’s fine if you leave the app open all night, but that would would really drain your battery if you are using your phone.

title: Subpar New Update
text:
I am so disappointed in the new update to this app. Previously, I would have given the app and the monitor 4 stars because my husband and I love the functionality of the wifi enabled camera, etc. 

However, as the other reviewers have pointed out, this last update makes this monitor essentially useless and annoying with the sound issues. Baby is sick tonight and it would be wonderful to have my working monitor back.

UPDATE:
Although the monitor no longer quits in the middle of the night, about a year ago, the monitor started letting only one user access at a time. This is supremely not helpful to us as a two-parent household. Please fix this functionality.

title: Shut down
text: The newest update has caused the app to shut down frequently, I have to constantly re-open the app when watching our baby sleep.

title: Great app/Outdated View Logs
text: Amazing app. Everything works as advertised minus the View Logs. These are always three to four days old. This becomes a pain when I go to see views the baby monitor. Either way, I recommend this app/device to anyone looking for a good monitor.

title: When it works it’s great
text: I would not recommend this monitor to a friend. I picked it out and loved it at first but it is very unreliable. I’m constantly having to delete the app and download it again to get the camera and my phone to connect. Very frustrating. I have it three stars because it works great when it’s doing what it’s supposed to.

title: Good updates
text: Still having some issues getting the white noise to turn on but other than that I like the updates

title: So irritated
text:
This app is so touchy, specifically the sound. The issue with the sound (white noise) turning off randomly or changing to a lullaby, has now woken my newborn up over a dozen times. I’m not sure what’s causing it, as it can happen in the middle of the night while my phone is in the same spot next to the monitor, or when I am downstairs. 
Beyond frustrated and ready just to get a sound machine and separate monitor.

title: 1000 alerts
text: The app alerts about 40 times a minute when there is no movement and sometimes nobody is even in the room when the alerts go off. I’m always thinking my baby is moving when the app just keeps going off for no reason. Then when I try to change the alert settings, it will not change. The only way it stops is if I turn the alerts completely off. Annoying and not dependable!!!

title: Used to work great…
text: The app used to work great and recently I updated it because there was an update available. Now the app crashes all the time, it won’t even stay up for 5 minutes. I used to be able to go to bed and throughout the night I could check the monitor and it never crashed. Frustrating that an “update” to make a product better made it worse.

title: Not user friendly
text: Not only did it take 30 minutes of trying to “invite” others with NO LUCK (the app would open, but go no further).  Each one of us had to make our own account, but we got the device to connect ONCE, now it just says “camera not on”.....thank goodness we have some time to get a different monitor before the baby is born.  In my opinion, this monitor is junk!

title: Great
text: Love the new app update with the multiple devices viewing. Any chance you can push another update out with the landscape option for multiple device viewing? Thank you

title: Heartstrings
text: Unlike the angst-settling aspect of a babycam for parents, grandparents can enjoy some autonomy in watching “their baby” sleep, wake and wriggle without disturbing a parent trying to Get Something Done.  I love this glimpse into my grandchild’s world and the freedom of access this device gives me.

title: I love it but...
text:
I love this baby monitor but the sensors go off from shadows and when you are watching it the notifications still come through.
I wish there was an easy access sleep mode switch on the main screen or the menu 
I wish there was a notification switch on the main menu Or screen

title: Disappointing
text: It’s nice  to be able  to check in on my toddler but the camera often doesn’t move or takes forever to move, the video stream freezes up constantly, regardless of whether I’m on WiFi or my network, the sound is in and out, and the app takes forever to open. Would not recommend, especially at this price point!

title: Usb doesn’t work. HELP.
text: I connected it with my work iPad, and my sons iPad. When I connected them to those devices, it popped up the “Share Wifi” when I connect it to my personal phone, it doesn’t. I tried resetting, turning it off and on, turning off wifi and on again, everything. nothing works, but it does on the other devices just fine. does it not work on iPhone 11 Pro Max? Or what. please help.

title: Can’t get it to start - app not working
text: I downloaded the app and the simple set up if faulty. The status bar goes to completion, and then all of a sudden the status bar ‘elongates’ and appears to extend off the right edge of my iPhone screen and nothing else happens. I have tried multiple times to unplug power, usb, restart app, etc but the same thing keeps happening. I opened a ticket for technical assistance 48 hours ago but still have not heard back yet.

title: App constantly drops
text: This app constantly drops the past 6 months. Super frustrating when it’s the middle of the night and you can’t hear your baby! I have emailed the company so many times and I haven’t had any resolution. I’m ready to get a new monitor and would not recommend this to any mom at this point. They need to fix this issue! Their monitors are too expensive for this to be failing!!!

title: Need an Apple TV app!
text:
iPhone app is great, I think most of the issues I have are on my end with my internet connection at times.

I WOULD LOVE an Apple TV app that allows Picture-in-Picture, I think Apple TVs support that.

title: Very bad app
text: The app is so bad it makes the monitors, which are pretty good, worthless. The concept of the app is pretty good too - if only the company fixed all the known issues. Starting with the most important one - the constant crashing. Sometimes it’s so bad that I can’t even open the app, it crashes right away. Other times, it crashes randomly in the night and you are left without a monitor.

title: Flat out does not work
text: Purchased the M2C thinking it was an easy affordable option. The app does not work for us at all. Whenever I or my child’s mother try to go to the 3rd step after changing the wifi to the device, it gives us a notification to change the wifi to the device again, as if we never switch it. Returning the item tomorrow. I do NOT recommend.

title: Customer Service Doesn’t Work!
text: I had issues setting this up at another home, and it wouldn’t complete the set up. No problem, I just called customer service. No answer, and the voicemail is full. Please have correct number with working voicemail for your clients!

title: Certificate Fake? Data might be taken?
text: We keep getting this message that the app might be someone else pretending to be IBaby and that our confidential info might be at risk. What the what? Brutal. For the last 2 weeks this thing has broken down one day after another. Constantly having to replug in to the base, etc. not good. Especially with a 3 month at home who is up and down with the slightest noice. Thanks, IBabyCare, if that’s who you actually are. Don’t buy.

title: Sound kicks off randomly
text: Completely randomly the sound will turn off or will be playing static but won’t transmit actually noise. I haven’t found a consistent cause and my baby just screaMed for 10 minutes in the middle of the night before my mom sense woke me up and I happened to check the monitor. It took over an hour to get him settled he was so worked up. This is not okay.

title: Disappointed
text: We had high hopes for this monitor. The monitor often freezes. This can sometimes be remedied by turning the monitor off and on, but I am too nervous to rely solely on this monitor, so we actually have a cheap audio monitor that we use, and then just use the video piece of this monitor when we hear the baby move. Unfortunately even that doesn’t always work. It is such a waste and we will need to buy another monitor soon.

title: Do not buy!
text: At first this product was great but now the app doesn’t work. Baby sound and movement notifications do not work. The video takes too long to load.  I would suggest buying something that isn’t app dependent. The company is aware there is a problem. They blame it on the recent IOS update - which I haven’t done. Very disappointed that I will have to but a new product to replace this after only using for 8 months.

title: Crashes every time I re-open
text: The app works well: it does everything for us it claims. When we re-open the app, however, we see the prior image fixed for a few seconds, then the app crashes. This means either force quitting or re-re-opening every time, which gets pretty annoying.

title: Notifications problem
text:
Great app and product but latest iOS update has made notifications only alert when app is open! (Useless!) please fix!

Also stinks that the night view is terrible (if any visibility) when the camera is up high looking down. Only way to fix is to hook to wall at 90 degree angle (which means hace to Adhere to base with duct tape!). The view from 90 degrees is great!!

title: Split screen with multiple devices
text: Oh how I have waited for this feature.   Can we get less white screen when we only have 2 devices and have it work in landscape mode.

title: Latest version is terrible
text: We’ve had the M7 for over 2 years and haven’t had any major issues until the latest update.  The update makes the app/camera completely worthless. It constantly crashes. I’ve attempted to reach out for support but they haven’t responded to email or on Twitter. Sounds like it’s time to find a reliable company and product.

title: Great Camera, Inefficient App
text: The camera and equipment work well. The only issue is that the app runs in the background and drains your battery and data if you don’t force close it. There really needs to be an option to turn this off if not needed.

title: App shuts down
text: I’ve had this camera since September 2019, have been using since December 2019 when son was born. For the last 6 weeks, the app has shut down after being in use for 30 seconds. Never fails, every time I open it, 30 seconds later it shuts down. We have loved this camera until now. Really wish this would be fixed.

title: Used to be great...
text: Had their product since 2015...just bought a new one...it stopped working after 1 month...when tried to utilize customer support dismal experience. After two weeks giving up and looking for new product. Family member I had recommended it to original is experiencing the same issues. Wish they had their act together as used to really enjoy product.

title: Latest update causes the app to crash
text: Frustrating that the latest update constantly causes the app to crash- causing me to wake up all night to reload it. It’s been well over a week and no update to fix? Not acceptable when you rely on this to monitor your baby. Will be getting a completely new system now that baby 2 is on the way.

title: Used to be good, now kills battery and has glitchy audio
text: You now have to force quit the app in order to do it from killing your battery. PROS:
-Night mode makes eyes look like raccoons so you can tell if your child is asleep or awake by their glowing pupils
-Viewing in landscape or portrait mode

The camera will likely have to be mounted high up on the wall, which is also an issue with the poor res, not to mention wires that will run along the wall
-Monitor lights might be distracting for your child. It took my daughter a while to not be lured/kept up by the monitor’s red night-mode lights

-Long videos get cut off. It will display full time but the footage will stop after a few minutes.
