title: UPDATE (again) - This camera is going in the trash TODAY
text:
UPDATE (again) - I know that I just emailed iBaby Labs about my new problem, but I just can’t take it anymore. This isn’t a very complicated process, and it is a very important need for parents. These cameras are meant, first and foremost, to serve as a monitoring tool for a parent to watch over a small child. Simply put, any parent who relies on iBaby is compromising the ability to monitor the child’s safety and well-being. I am done with iBaby! A new glitch in the camera now causes the audio feed to turn off completely while the audio connection/icon remains highlighted. So, within minutes of turning on the camera and audio connection, the audio feed cuts out completely while the app gives absolutely no indication that something isn’t working. I have had the same camera for over a year, and for the most part everything has worked as expected in that first year. But these last few months have seen nothing but unreliable problems. I do not want to put my child in a position where we cannot hear him for hours and hours at a time. What if he is sick, what if he has a nightmare, what if climbs out of the crib!? There are a number of things that a parent simply NEEDS to know are happening ... and iBaby is not the type of partner that values those needs. Good bye. 

UPDATE-All of my previous issues have been addressed and corrected. Thank you for listening to your customer feedback.

While I'm sure everyone has their own features that are most important to them, here are the biggest issues I have with recent iBabyCare updates:

(1)  There is a significant delay in loading the app. Before it was much faster, and if you already had it running and just were switching back on iOS there was hardly any delay. After the recent updates, there seems to be some substantial reloading or relogging in process. 

(2)  There quality control process for the programmers of this app now seems to be LIVE updates with trial & error. This app is very important and personal to a lot of parents. We do not want to hope that the app is working. We do not want to wait until big fixes are pushed out before making sure that our children are alright. 

I used to speak very highly of this app, and regularly recommended it to family and friends. That is absolutely no longer the case. I would feel completely embarrassed to pass along the iBabyCare name only to have a new parent come back to me questioning what I suggested to rely on for monitoring their baby. 

No thanks!!!

-- A very disappointed parent.

However the decrease in stars is that you don't have that much control to the access of individuals you invite. Great for grandparents to have access ... however they can hear and see live images at all times once you invite . There is no option to turn off/ on access temporarily. I doubt anyone wants baby's grandparents hearing/ seeing ANYTIME they want... as owner/ parent of baby you would want more control (example turn of hearing access). Further you can delete user but they still can see / hear everything (you might think, "ok I deleted I can say anything / do anything ... NOOOO!!!) . If they don't close the app, they may NEVER close it, then they STILL have access to everything. They must close app after you've deleted them in order for them not to have access anymore . Good concept overall and a 5 star option but glitches in the areas I mentioned that are really scary to think you've deleted someone access yet BIG possibility they are still seeing/ hearing everything . Careful out there

title: Kills Bluetooth headphones
text: This app has a clean aesthetic and when it works, it is pretty good. That said, it is terrible with app switching (freezes and crashes), it has no mechanism for letting you know that the “video” of your sleeping child is actually a still frame and 15 minutes old because the feed is down, and if you want to use bluetooth headphones at all while the app is open you can forget it. Another baby cam I have has a crappy app, but at least allows me to listen to my phone with bluetooth headphones while monitoring my kid. It would also be nice to have an auto-mute feature that allows you to not have to hear the white noise of your kids empty room constantly throughout nap time or the whole night. The biggest issue is, however, that you can sometimes go a while with no indication that the app and or video feed froze.  The other day the app was frozen for nearly 15 minutes on a still image of what appeared to be a sleeping baby. If she hadn’t been in a rocker that I could tell wasn’t moving it would have been easy to think that everything was still fine even if it wasn’t. I don’t expect this type of tech to be flawless, but I should be notified when a problem is occurring so that it can be addressed, or I can at least choose to ignore it.

title: Best Camera Option Out There!!
text: We love ibaby! We have been using it for the past 9 months. Love you can speak through the monitor, play music, take photos/videos. Both of our moms will peek in on the baby from their homes, and I love being able to check in on our baby during date night or when I am traveling. Like all software, there are a few issues we ran into: We love having both a night vision option or regular camera setting. It will automatically switch between the two based on the light in the room. We ended up defaulting to night vision all the time because it would occasionally "click" back and forth between the two in the middle of the day and make a noise. Also, one of the updated releases there was a audio "bug" where it would cut in and out on sound. I called the customer service line and they immediately explained the issue, let me know when it would be fixed and in the meantime provided me a new link to download a temporary app where the audio didn't cut in and out. I was extremely happy with their customer service. For me, the flexibility of having control of all aspects from my phone is a game changer.

title: It's a great camera and great app

Then a friend told me to check this monitor and I ordered online mine is ibaby m6 I think, lol. It's the one works with wifi and phone package as well. title: Almost perfect
text:
Since this is a review about the app itself I'll focus on that but touch on a couple of other things that would round out the product nicely.

title: App (& monitor) works great!
text: Display & functionality is far better than a previous Motorola unit we had been using.  Lights on the monitor can be distracting to baby esp in a blacked out room. Monitor also a little noisey when panning. But overall works great if these issues don't upset your baby. We're using the iBaby app on our iPhone 6+'s with an M6 Monitor purchased in Feb 2015.  Setup is a breeze although the app would often freeze when both phones we're being used (easy fix: both users should use the same iBaby account rather than each user's individual acct). We added a 2nd monitor a few months later but this also caused random freeze ups.  A quick call to iBaby's customer service dept, along with a subsequent email from them with step by step instructions on how to reset the monitor, and both of our apps & monitors have been working great ever since. We've been using it every day for the past 10 mos & love it.

title: Horrible app with alert inconsistencies
text:
I recently got the m6t baby monitor and am having issues with alerts. The app has portion of notification and alert tone (alarm) when it detects motion/sound. The notification works fine all the time. However, the alert tone only plays sometimes. I have ensured that the phone is not in silent mode and volume/ringers are at increased level. With the lack of a separate device for viewing/ controlling the baby monitor (like many other brands provide), I feel this is a huge flaw in the software or the device. The whole purpose of the monitor is to get alert when baby is moving or crying and iBaby monitor/ software isn't doing that consistently!
There are other secondary issues in the app too. Sometimes the settings just keeps on loading and I have have to restart the app to get it working again.

I am surprised how people could design such poor product or app when it comes to baby safety. I recommend everyone to stay out of this product. I just opened ticket with the support team but I am honestly thinking of returning this product after reading other reviews that have issues like mine.

title: It's great!

title: Not as bad as the reviews say
text: We've had it for 4 months now. I love the features (being able to listen, speak, record, take pictures, view remotely, play music, have multiple ppl "in control" if desired, all from your phone, etc). Installation was super easy. As with most baby monitors, it was hard to find a spot that can view the entire crib. We ended up taking down one side of the crib bumpers for that reason. You definitely have to have your phone charging if using for a prolonged time. Our picture quality is excellent. We bought a second one for the family room. title: Excellent so far....
text: Bought this last night on January 22, 2015, and I know I'm the second person to post a review but so far this thing is awesome. The tech is top notch and I'm sure the software will get better. It's a little pricey but I think worth every penny! Very VERY user friendly!!!

title: Decent, but missing some important music features.
text:
Most importantly: this monitor/app combo gives NO notification when the feed cuts out.  If you're not actively watching your device screen to make sure the feed is still up, you will have no idea that your baby has been crying for the last 20 minutes straight.  This is an ENORMOUS and very fixable problem that I cannot believe the company has ignored.  It's worsened after each firmware update as the app loses connection every six minutes or so, and now (Feb. 2017) it seems as though shifting the app to the background makes it cut the feed entirely.  Reopening causes a refresh. 

I spoke with iBaby support and was promised that fixes were in the works - as of November 2015.  It's been over a year and the problems have only worsened, and support still says variations on 'in the works.'  As the wife of a web developer, I know that the problems I'm hoping to see fixed would take a couple of developers a day or two to add in, so this is ridiculous.

Now that they are paying attention to issues with the app and offering updates, it's been great!

text: I first thought this product was okay, despite needing to be used with my iPhone only. That was before I couldn't even get it to work with my iPhone. I am very disappointed that I have to shop for another one when this was expensive as it was!

title: Unreliable app and awful customer service
text: I am rarely motivated enough to write reviews, but this app is so atrocious that I felt compelled to warn other people not to waste their money! Do yourself a favor and buy a different monitor. You will spend half your time resetting and reinstalling this thing to get it to work. You will have ZERO peace of mind with this product. The app often crashed on us in the middle of the night. title: M6
text: I have had the m6 for about 7 months now and this version of the app has some definite improvements. I have my family, from out of state, linked to the live feed so they can watch her anytime...but what's great is the sleep mode function that only allows me to view the camera. The movement and sound notifications are great, I just wish there was an alert that notified you when the temperature in the room changes or falls below a certain degree. I've had some issues where the feed would take awhile to load or it would just keep loading and no picture. There are times it has loaded but the picture seems to freeze and the control of the camera doesn't work. Overall I am satisfied with it and it was definitely worth the money.

title: Alert Settings, App is laggy, no iPad app
text:
***Update: Garbage, no improvements whatsoever, app freezes constantly, lag is ridiculous (and it has nothing to do with the fact that it's on wifi), and it's been on the black screen with the Loading spinner all day! That's the only thing consistent each day, seeing the black screen. Straight garbage and not worthy of 1 star!***

The actual hardware (camera) is great, however the software (app) is not at all:

1. Alert settings continuously change and do not work as expected. The on/off toggles change from one moment to another (ie, motion alert, sound alert, alert tone, notifications). This solution is supposed to give you piece of mind and the app is failing me. 

2. The app has some noticeable lags in it that you can observe in alert settings and the video itself. My wifi connection is perfectly fine by the way.

3. There is no native iPad app and it is a bit deceiving to advertise and claim that it is compatible with an iPad. This is false. Sure, you can download the iPhone app into the iPad, but you can do this for any other iPhone app. Either create a native iPad app or do not claim that it is compatible with an iPad, disappointing.

The camera and app combo is promising, but the app needs to be corrected. At this point, I may have to just return this camera and buy one of the standard Motorola sets.
